title: Grammar Foundations
desc: Master the basics of tenses and verbs.

questions.q: My brother ______ video games every Sunday.
questions.exp: Third person singular routine = Present Simple (plays).

questions.q: ______ you like chocolate?
We ______ to the zoo yesterday.
She is ______ a book right now.
There ______ two cats in the garden.
I ______ my homework yet.
Listen! The birds ______ in the trees.
If it ______ tomorrow, we will stay home.
She ______ speak French very well.
That is the ______ cake I have ever eaten!
Which word is a synonym of 'Happy'?
What is the opposite of 'Brave'?
A person who treats sick people is a ______.
Which word is spelled correctly?
I use an ______ to stay dry in the rain.
A place where you can borrow books is a ______.
Which of these is a fruit?
questions.exp: Mango is a fruit; the others are vegetables.

questions.q: What do you call the brother of your father?
questions.exp: Your father's brother is your uncle.

questions.q: Which word describes a very large hill?
questions.exp: A mountain is a large natural elevation.

questions.q: The word 'Enormous' means very ______.

title: Fun with Phrases
desc: Learn common English idioms and expressions.

questions.q: What does 'A piece of cake' mean?
questions.exp: If something is 'a piece of cake', it is very easy to do.

questions.q: If someone is 'Under the weather', they are ______.
questions.exp: This idiom means feeling slightly unwell.

questions.q: To 'Break a leg' means ______.
questions.exp: We say 'break a leg' to wish performers good luck.

questions.q: What does 'Hold your horses' mean?
questions.exp: It means to slow down or wait.

questions.q: If it's 'Raining cats and dogs', it is ______.
questions.exp: This describes a very heavy downpour.

questions.q: What is the meaning of 'Once in a blue moon'?
questions.exp: This describes something that happens very seldom.

questions.q: To 'Hit the books' means to ______.
questions.exp: This is a common idiom for studying.

questions.q: If you are 'In the same boat', you are ______.
questions.exp: It means being in the same difficult circumstances as others.

questions.q: What does 'Break the ice' mean?
questions.exp: To 'break the ice' is to make people feel more relaxed.

questions.q: To 'Let the cat out of the bag' means ______.
questions.exp: This means to accidentally reveal a secret.
